meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a vixen.
meanings.sent1: Her sly smile had a vixenish charm.
meanings.sent2: The actress portrayed a vixenish character in the play.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat had a vixenish glint in its eyes.
meanings.sent4: The stormy sky took on a vixenish hue as the sun set.
meanings.sent5: The forest at night had a vixenish feel, full of hidden dangers.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities of a vixen.
meanings.sent1: The vixenish woman captivated everyone with her boldness.
meanings.sent2: Her vixenish behavior caused quite a stir at the party.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy's vixenish antics amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a vixenish charm, mysterious and alluring.
meanings.sent5: The vixenish wind whispered secrets through the trees.

meanings.sent1: She gave him a vixenish look, daring him to challenge her.
meanings.sent2: The vixenish girl flirted shamelessly with the boys.
meanings.sent3: His vixenish attitude got him into trouble with the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The vixenish fox outsmarted the hunters at every turn.
meanings.sent5: Her vixenish nature made her both feared and admired in the village.
